description: First occurrence of n consecutive n's in the decimal expansion of Pi.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Earls Sequence
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pi Digits
example: 1 first occurs at position 1 after the decimal point.22 first occurs at position 135.333 first occurs at position 1698.10101010101010101010 does not occur in the first 1.1*10^10 digits of Pi - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Jul 19 2013
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), May 27 2001
extensions: Entry revised by Don Reble, Apr 06 2006
